Title: Prove that if $\int f^2$ and $\int( f'')^2$ converge, so does $\int (f')^2$
Content:
Question: Let $f: [a,\infty) \to \Bbb R \in C^2$ and the two following integrals converge:
  $$\int _a^\infty (f''(x))^2\,dx ,~~~~~~~~~ \int _a^\infty (f(x))^2\,dx$$ Prove that $\int _a^\infty (f'(x)^2)\,dx$ converges as well. What we tried: Taylor expansion, Lagrange mean value theorem, integration by parts, comparison test, limit comparison test, none really helped us get there...
